Our Vision

BallerTV was founded in 2016 by Cramster co-founders Rob Angarita and Aaron Hawkey to provide live video coverage of amateur sports while creating sports media job opportunities in local communities. As of 2018, BallerTV is now a coast-to-coast operation with a network of thousands of broadcasters across the country. We’re on track to broadcast our 100,000th game this year — and we’re just getting started.

Our Team

Our founders started BallerTV in 2016 with a scrappy 6-man development team — we’re now at 20 full-time office staff and roughly 2,000 broadcasting operations staff coast-to-coast, and growing every day. From software engineers, to sales staff to operations managers, BallerTV is constantly innovating broadcasting and logistics solutions to build the world’s widest sports network.

We assemble fearless teams, trained to dominate operations challenges and deliver top-notch content to our subscribers.

Leave it All on the Floor

Lakers had Kobe, we’ve got "Bobe". Bobe’s work ethic is unmatched and is the example by which all of us should follow. We have a generational opportunity to build a game changing sports media company, so we should pursue our mission until we have nothing left to give and feel confident that, if we do this, all our hard work will be worth the effort.

Move Without the Ball

We’re constantly trying to create opportunities for our teammates by finding ways to be helpful — even when the spotlight isn’t on us.

Don't Play Scared

We are going big, and willing to take calculated risks in pursuit of our mission. We understand that all bets won’t work out, but we will learn from all our mistakes and grow regardless.

Team > Player

MJ said, “Talent wins games, but teamwork and intelligence win championships.” We are here to win championships.

Win the "Right" Way

We believe “success without character is failure”. We treat all our coworkers, customers, event operators and network of site leads and broadcasters with respect, and with the utmost integrity.

Everyone Broadcasts

We are scrappy and we do whatever it takes to achieve our goals. Everyone starts as a broadcaster.

Preparedness

John Wooden famously said, “failing to prepare is preparing to fail.” We don’t cut corners and we don’t leave anything to chance. We make our own luck.
